structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases

law.catch_line: Assault With Dangerous Weapon; Victim Sixty Or Older; Punishment; Subsequent Offenses

text.section: Whoever, by means of a dangerous weapon, commits an assault upon a person sixty years or older, shall be punished by imprisonment in the state prison for not more than five years or by a fine of not more than one thousand dollars or imprisonment in jail for not more than two and one-half years.

Whoever, by means of a dangerous weapon, commits an assault upon another shall be punished by imprisonment in the state prison for not more than five years or by a fine of not more than one thousand dollars or imprisonment in jail for not more than two and one-half years.
